questions.question: Which of the following is a key principle of corporate governance?
questions.explanation: Transparency and disclosure is one of the fundamental principles of corporate governance, ensuring that stakeholders have access to relevant information about the company's operations and performance.

questions.question: The concept of 'fiduciary duty' in corporate governance refers to:
options: The duty to maximize profits at any cost
The legal obligation of directors to act in the best interests of the company
The responsibility to avoid all business risks
The requirement to distribute all profits as dividends
questions.explanation: Fiduciary duty requires directors and officers to act in good faith and in the best interests of the company and its shareholders, putting the company's interests above their personal interests.
